pull.title: Remove boost::program_options dependency
pull.body: Concept from #12744, but without parsing negated options.

events.body:
I'm utAck on this. Nicely done.

This could have also been implemented with regex, but the pattern is simple enough that the logic is easily understandable.
Concept ACK - maybe include the tests from #12744?
@Empact  Those tests have been added by #12713
Current on master, if there are some options in the config file without `=`, they would cause an exception. In this PR, I simply ignore them, or should I also throw an exception?

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->Note to reviewers: This pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #13562 (travis: Switch back to trusty for now by MarcoFalke)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: gui: Drop qt4 support
issue.body:
Implements #8263.

Qt4.x has been EOL since 2015, and at least Gentoo has, or is going to drop support for it. I wouldn't be surprised if other Linux distributions follow.

This removes Qt4 detection from the build system, as well as removes all Qt4 fallbacks from the code. Turns out there's more than I expected: this is going to make maintenance of the GUI code, as well as adding new features significantly easier.

(I know there's still some references left to qt4 in RPM and Debian build script, but I don't have the knowledge how to fix them)

issue.title: travis: Switch back to trusty for now
issue.body:
Trusty is still used for gitian builds, so we might want to prevent build failures, such as https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/13538#issuecomment-400144400 by switching travis back to trusty for now.

Apart from setting `ubuntu:14.04`, this reverts the windows cross build environment to the version of wine we used to use previously.

issue.title: commits from bitcoin/master
issue.body:
tests: fixes mininode's P2PConnection sending messages on closing transport
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13715

depends: disable Werror when building zmq
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13689

[trivial] Correct help text for `importaddress` RPC
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13074

wallet: Fix non-determinism in ParseHDKeypath(...). Avoid using an uninitialized variable in path calculation.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13712

Add createwallet "disableprivatekeys" option: a sane mode for watchonly-wallets
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9662

docs: Specify preferred Python string formatting technique
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13718

p2p: Remove dead service bits code
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11637

lint: Add linter for circular dependencies
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13695

Remove boost::program_options dependency
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13482

Fix bitcoin-cli --version
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13725

Utils and libraries: Removes the boost/algorithm/string/join dependency
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13726

wallet: Introduce assertion to document the assumption that cache and cache_used are always set in tandem
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13683

trivial: Replace CPubKey::operator[] with CPubKey::vch where possible
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13722

Remove redundant variables, statements and forward declarations
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13691

doc: Remove field in getblocktemplate help that has never been used.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12764

Avoid locking mutexes that are already held by the same thread
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11762

Utils: Refactor ArgsManager a little
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13733

Drop dead code from Stacks
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13633

Net: Fixed a race condition when disabling the network.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13212

trivial: remove unneeded include
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13740

Avoid creating a temporary vector for size-prefixed elements
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13719

tests: Skip P2PConnection's is_closing() check when not available
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13747

issue.title: Error if # is used in rpcpassword in conf
[Util] Remove boost program_options dependency
issue.body:
Follow-up to #2324 which backports https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13482

This removes the dependency on Boost's program_options module

issue.title: depends: Remove boost::program_options dependency
issue.body:
The code that called boost program options here may have been replaced with the config overhaul.  It appears the dependency has been unused since.  Let's axe it.

Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13482

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -282,6 +282,17 @@ class ArgsManager
      * Check whether we know of this arg
      */
     bool IsArgKnown(const std::string& key, std::string& error);
+
+private:
+    /**
+     * Trim string by the pattern
+     */
+    std::string trimString(std::string str, const std::string& pattern);
comments.body: Is there a reason for this method to start with a lower case letter while all other start with upper case letters?
Minor: can use `std::make_pair(name, value)` for simplicity.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -282,6 +282,17 @@ class ArgsManager
      * Check whether we know of this arg
      */
     bool IsArgKnown(const std::string& key, std::string& error);
+
+private:
+    /**
+     * Trim string by the pattern
+     */
+    std::string trimString(std::string str, const std::string& pattern);
comments.body: No reason. So make it uppercase.
Coding style nit: use braces whenever indenting.
Maybe introduce a static constant for this set of trimmable characters?
I'm not sure this is what you want.
This can just be a static function; it doesn't need to be a method of `ArgsManager`.
